trans-unit.source: Two-Class Support Vector Machine
trans-unit.target: Two-Class Support Vector Machine

trans-unit.source: Creates a binary classification model using the Support Vector Machine algorithm
trans-unit.target: Creates a binary classification model using the Support Vector Machine algorithm

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Support Vector Machine</ui> module to create a model that is based on the support vector machine algorithm.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Support Vector Machine</ui> module to create a model that is based on the support vector machine algorithm.

trans-unit.source: The classifier that this module initializes is useful for predicting between two possible outcomes that depend on continuous or categorical predictor variables.
trans-unit.target: The classifier that this module initializes is useful for predicting between two possible outcomes that depend on continuous or categorical predictor variables.

trans-unit.source: This model is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.
trans-unit.target: This model is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.

trans-unit.source: You can train the model by providing the model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can train the model by providing the model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Support Vector Machines
trans-unit.target: Understanding Support Vector Machines

trans-unit.source: Support vector machines (SVMs) are supervised learning models that analyze data and recognize patterns.
trans-unit.target: Support vector machines (SVMs) are supervised learning models that analyze data and recognize patterns.

trans-unit.source: They can be used for classification and regression tasks.
trans-unit.target: They can be used for classification and regression tasks.

trans-unit.source: The classifier that is created by this module is useful for predicting between two possible outcomes that depend on continuous or categorical predictor variables.
trans-unit.target: The classifier that is created by this module is useful for predicting between two possible outcomes that depend on continuous or categorical predictor variables.

trans-unit.source: Given a set of training examples labeled as belonging to one of two classes, the SVM algorithm assigns new examples into one category or the other.
trans-unit.target: Given a set of training examples labeled as belonging to one of two classes, the SVM algorithm assigns new examples into one category or the other.

trans-unit.source: The examples are represented as points in space, and they are mapped so that the examples of the separate categories are divided by a clear gap that is as wide as possible.
trans-unit.target: The examples are represented as points in space, and they are mapped so that the examples of the separate categories are divided by a clear gap that is as wide as possible.

trans-unit.source: New examples are then mapped into that same space and predicted to belong to a category based on which side of the gap they fall on.
trans-unit.target: New examples are then mapped into that same space and predicted to belong to a category based on which side of the gap they fall on.

trans-unit.source: The feature space that contains the training examples is sometimes called a <newTerm>hyperplane</newTerm>, and it may have many dimensions.
trans-unit.target: The feature space that contains the training examples is sometimes called a <newTerm>hyperplane</newTerm>, and it may have many dimensions.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure an SVM Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure an SVM Model

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: If you know how you want to configure the neural network, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.
trans-unit.target: If you know how you want to configure the neural network, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.

trans-unit.source: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.
trans-unit.target: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by specifying multiple values and using a parameter sweep to find the optimal configuration.

trans-unit.source: During training, all combinations of the settings you provided will be tested to determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.
trans-unit.target: During training, all combinations of the settings you provided will be tested to determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.

trans-unit.source: Set other parameters that control the behavior of the support vector model, such as.
trans-unit.target: Set other parameters that control the behavior of the support vector model, such as.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section.

trans-unit.source: Connect a tagged dataset and train the model.
trans-unit.target: Connect a tagged dataset and train the model.

trans-unit.source: If you set <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, train the model by using a tagged dataset and the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you set <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Single Parameter</ui>, train the model by using a tagged dataset and the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: If you set <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> and a tagged dataset.
trans-unit.target: If you set <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui>, train the model using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> and a tagged dataset.

trans-unit.source: You can then use the trained model, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.
trans-unit.target: You can then use the trained model, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: The module can be customized by using these parameters:
trans-unit.target: The module can be customized by using these parameters:

trans-unit.source: Create trainer mode
trans-unit.target: Create trainer mode

trans-unit.source: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:
trans-unit.target: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Number of iterations
trans-unit.target: Number of iterations

trans-unit.source: Type a number that denotes the number of iterations used when building the model.
trans-unit.target: Type a number that denotes the number of iterations used when building the model.

trans-unit.source: This parameter can be used to control trade-off between training speed and accuracy.
trans-unit.target: This parameter can be used to control trade-off between training speed and accuracy.

trans-unit.source: Lambda
trans-unit.target: Lambda

trans-unit.source: Specify a value to use as the weight for L1 regularization.
trans-unit.target: Specify a value to use as the weight for L1 regularization.

trans-unit.source: This regularization coefficient can be used to tune the model.
trans-unit.target: This regularization coefficient can be used to tune the model.

trans-unit.source: Larger values penalize more complex models.
trans-unit.target: Larger values penalize more complex models.

trans-unit.source: Normalize features
trans-unit.target: Normalize features

trans-unit.source: Select this option to normalize features before training.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to normalize features before training.

trans-unit.source: If you apply normalization, before training, data points are centered at the mean and scaled to have one unit of standard deviation.
trans-unit.target: If you apply normalization, before training, data points are centered at the mean and scaled to have one unit of standard deviation.

trans-unit.source: Project to the unit sphere
trans-unit.target: Project to the unit sphere

trans-unit.source: Select this option to normalize coefficients by projecting values to unit space.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to normalize coefficients by projecting values to unit space.

trans-unit.source: Before training, data points are centered at the mean and scaled to have one unit of standard deviation.
trans-unit.target: Before training, data points are centered at the mean and scaled to have one unit of standard deviation.

trans-unit.source: Random number seed
trans-unit.target: Random number seed

trans-unit.source: Specify a seed if you want to ensure reproducibility across runs.
trans-unit.target: Specify a seed if you want to ensure reproducibility across runs.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown category
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown category

trans-unit.source: Select this option to create a group for unknown values in the training or validation sets.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to create a group for unknown values in the training or validation sets.

trans-unit.source: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values that are contained in the training data.
trans-unit.target: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values that are contained in the training data.

trans-unit.source: In the former case, the model might be less precise for known values, but it can provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.
trans-unit.target: In the former case, the model might be less precise for known values, but it can provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: For this model type, it is recommended that you normalize the dataset before using it to train the classifier.
trans-unit.target: For this model type, it is recommended that you normalize the dataset before using it to train the classifier.

trans-unit.source: Support vector machines are among the earliest of machine learning algorithms, and SVM models have been used in many applications, from information retrieval to text and image classification.
trans-unit.target: Support vector machines are among the earliest of machine learning algorithms, and SVM models have been used in many applications, from information retrieval to text and image classification.

trans-unit.source: Although recent research has developed algorithms that have higher accuracy, this algorithm can work well on simple data sets when your goal is speed over accuracy.
trans-unit.target: Although recent research has developed algorithms that have higher accuracy, this algorithm can work well on simple data sets when your goal is speed over accuracy.

trans-unit.source: If you do not get the desired results by using <ui>Two-Class Support Vector Model</ui>, try one of these classification methods:
trans-unit.target: If you do not get the desired results by using <ui>Two-Class Support Vector Model</ui>, try one of these classification methods:

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how this learning algorithm is used, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how this learning algorithm is used, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Direct marketing</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525168</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses an SVM model to classify customers by appetency.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Direct marketing</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525168</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses an SVM model to classify customers by appetency.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Credit risk prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525270</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses SVM for assessing credit risk.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Credit risk prediction</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525270</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses SVM for assessing credit risk.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Multiclass Classifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525730</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses an SVM model for handwriting recognition.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Multiclass Classifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525730</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses an SVM model for handwriting recognition.
